repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
closes #32016

The test fails if I add the check back in

comment_data.body:
You mentioned that you want to edit a quickfix buffer, so maybe it's worth setting up quickfix in this test. That gives extra coverage.

Also this test should make a small edit to the quickfix, then cancel the preview-command, then assert that the quickfix buffer was restored.

Also at the start and end of the test, assert that 'nomodifiable' is set on the buffer.

    eq(false, api.nvim_get_option_value('modifiable', {buf=<quickfix_buf_num>}))

What I basically want to do is to just add highlighting to the target buffer (quickfix in this case), it won't be possible to modify it either way because it is `nomodifiable` afaik.

When the preview callback modifies a `nomodifiable` buffer it errors out and silently fails, then the preview window just closes iirc, I guess I could test that?

Relevant part from the code

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/bbf36ef8ef86534e317e4e0153730a40ae4c936e/src/nvim/ex_getln.c#L2616-L2626

What happens if the preview callback sets 'modifiable', is it able to edit the buffer?

And then I wonder if Nvim automatically sets it back to 'nomodifable' after previewing is done ðŸ¤”

> What happens if the preview callback sets 'modifiable', is it able to edit the buffer?

Don't know, will check

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f7542773-e37b-4dad-99fd-39b37e269aa4


nvim does not reset the modifiable, only the buffer lines it seems like
I should add restoring  `modifiable` then right?

Added in [`7b2e553` (#32034)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32034/commits/7b2e553e47739081edc07e555246da5dc9ab54e5)

We can delete this commit if we decide that not restoring is the correct way to go.

IMO restoring makes sense as other parts such as lines / highlights are restored as well

looking at `save_b_p_ul` above, should this be a `Opt...` type instead of `int`? 

rebase on latest master to make sure you have recent changes related to the options code.

might as well also put this near `save_b_p_ul` so that the `b_p_...` things are grouped together.
Don't need separate tests. The "can preview nomodifiable" test can also edit the buffer and assert the stuff this test is doing.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/8a236c242a76825a6a9266feda45794c7328c807/src/nvim/buffer_defs.h#L576-L576

It is `int` in the original spec, while ul is OptInt, so not sure, I guess we either change both to OptInt or leave as int?
this is in news-breaking. please find the PLUGINS section in news-features, below :)
